intro: Tithymalus variabilis, commonly known as the variable tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring finely divided leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or meadows. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
